div.div: BEWARE THE LITTLE ONE

div.a: Will The iPad Mini Cannibalize iPad Sales?

div.div: If Apple ships the smaller iPad it’s expected to debut next week in time for the holidays, it will almost certainly sell a bunch of them. But what does that mean for sales of the larger iPad?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VdFlca&via=Digg&text=Will The iPad Mini Cannibalize iPad Sales?

div.div: MARRIAGE EQUALITY

div.a: Federal Appeals Court Rules DOMA Unconstitutional

div.div: Discriminated against gay people is now being considered in the same light as gender discrimination.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U9JYm6&via=Digg&text=Federal Appeals Court Rules DOMA Unconstitutional

div.div: GOOGLE

div.a: Why Google's Revenue Is Half A Billion Dollars Less Than Expected

div.div: The takeaway from Google’s prematurely released earnings report: They still haven’t figured out mobile. The company came up a half a billion dollars short of what analysts had projected for the quarter. Here are some explanations.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/R4hTb6&via=Digg&text=Why Google's Revenue Is Half A Billion Dollars Less Than Expected

div.div: THE BRONX

An organization simulates real war-injury scenarios at the Bronx Documentary Center, complete with pools of blood, contorted limbs and frenetic movement amid smoke-clad air, in order to train photographers and journalists in potentially life-saving techniques.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VdzT95&via=Digg&text=Where Do War Reporters Train?

div.div: RACE CARS

div.a: The Story Of The Ultimate 'Arrested Development' Race Car

div.div: Since the dawn of recorded time, television and the glitterati of Hollywood has brought us legendary cars that have become characters in their own right. But few of them have ever hit the track.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WsxhDQ&via=Digg&text=The Story Of The Ultimate 'Arrested Development' Race Car

div.div: INFOGRAPHICS

div.a: Which Dictator Killed The Most People?

div.div: There's no real winner here.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PCWf1x&via=Digg&text=Which Dictator Killed The Most People?

div.div: ARE YOU A FANILOW OR A BELIEBER?

div.a: From Trekkies To Twihards: How To Name Your Fandom

div.div: It's a natural urge: Fandoms are about communal identity, and there's nothing more communal than sharing a name. There are a few standard conventions to follow or flout.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RDPMit&via=Digg&text=From Trekkies To Twihards: How To Name Your Fandom

div.div: YES, YOU READ THAT RIGHT

div.a: Watch An Interview With The Man Who Witnessed Lincoln's Death

div.div: Samuel J. Seymore was just five years old when he was sitting at Ford's Theater in Washington D.C. when he saw a man fall out of the balcony.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XtXDDl&via=Digg&text=Watch An Interview With The Man Who Witnessed Lincoln's Death

div.div: BINDERS FULL OF BOYS

div.a: Boy Scout 'Perversion Files' Show Locals Helped Cover Up

div.div: Local Boy Scout leaders, police officials, prosecutors and mayors helped hush up numerous child sex abuse allegations against scoutmasters and other volunteers, according to details in a trove of nearly 15,000 pages of so-called "perversion files" compiled by the Scouts.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RHNM8T&via=Digg&text=Boy Scout 'Perversion Files' Show Locals Helped Cover Up

div.div: SAFE SEX SHOOTS

div.a: The Porn Star Who Thinks Condoms Should Be Required On Film

div.div: The porn industry has campaigned against Measure B, the L.A. County ballot initiative that would require performers to use condoms. But porn star Aurora Snow says it’s necessary.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RbRskD&via=Digg&text=The Porn Star Who Thinks Condoms Should Be Required On Film

div.div: MARTIAN BLING

div.a: Curiosity Rover Digs Up Shiny Particles On Mars

div.div: NASA's Mars rover Curiosity has found some more bright stuff on the Red Planet, scientists say.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RX6RVt&via=Digg&text=Curiosity Rover Digs Up Shiny Particles On Mars

div.div: LESS THAN A MOVIE TICKET

div.a: It Would Cost $11 Per Person To Prevent All Future Extinctions

div.div: A global effort to prevent all future species extinctions would cost about $80 billion a year, or $11.42 annually from every person on the planet, according to a study published last week in Science.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VfQ2uW&via=Digg&text=It Would Cost $11 Per Person To Prevent All Future Extinctions

div.div: SUICIDE NETS AND COFFEE SHOPS
What's inside Foxconn's gate may surprise you.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Xs41uM&via=Digg&text=Inside Foxconn

div.div: BRANDING

div.a: Why Sports Logos Are So Important

div.div: Brooklyn is bold enough on its own; the marketing minds behind the rebooted Nets NBA franchise didn’t want loud colors and boisterous designs to send a message.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WrbY5u&via=Digg&text=Why Sports Logos Are So Important

div.div: CONSPIRACIES

div.a: That Time A Japanese Cult May Have Used A Tesla Death Ray

div.div: On May 28, 1993, a remote and dusty thicket of the Australian outback shook for hundreds of miles around. Deep reverberating explosions could be heard far and wide, the night sky illuminated by sporadic flashes of unexplained light—all this allegedly witnessed by heavy goods drivers, gold prospectors and nomads traipsing the bush.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QuxgKw&via=Digg&text=That Time A Japanese Cult May Have Used A Tesla Death Ray

div.div: JEGGINGS STILL MOST INSULTING TREND

div.a: The Fashion World's Most Insulting Miscalculations

div.div: In 2011, J.C. Penney shoppers found a long-sleeved shirt for girls aged 7 to 16 that read: “I’m too pretty to do homework so my brother has to do it for me.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RIBaBY&via=Digg&text=The Fashion World's Most Insulting Miscalculations

div.div: APPLE

div.a: Apple's Lightning Connector: A Bumpy Ride To A New Accessory Standard

div.div: With a durable, double-sided, all-digital design, it might be a vast improvement in the long run. For now, it's a bit of a mess.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VcoQgp&via=Digg&text=Apple's Lightning Connector: A Bumpy Ride To A New Accessory Standard

div.div: 'I AM TO SOME DEGREE APOLOGIZING'
CNN has scored an exclusive interview with Michael Brutsch, the Redditor known as Violentacrez who was recently exposed by Gawker.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TwOFAV&via=Digg&text=CNN Interviews Reddit 'Jailbait' Moderator

div.div: MAKERS AND TAKERS

div.a: How Blue States Subsidize Red States

div.div: Want to know something ironic about American politics? Because rich people are Republicans but rich states vote Democratic, Democratic policies transfer wealth from Democratic places to Republican ones.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QuGGpr&via=Digg&text=How Blue States Subsidize Red States

div.div: DIGITAL HEIST

div.a: Reddit Users Steal Thousands Of Games From Electronics Arts

div.div: Reddit users are known to band together to perform large scale pranks at the expense of whatever organization may be at the brunt end of their ire.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RxXXgo&via=Digg&text=Reddit Users Steal Thousands Of Games From Electronics Arts

div.div: FLIP FLOPS, POPPED COLLARS REQUIRED

div.a: You Must Wear Boxer Briefs To Work On Abercrombie CEO's Luxury Jet

div.div: When the CEO makes a request, crew members should “respond by saying, ‘No problem.’ This should be used in place of phrases like, ‘Sure’ or ‘Just a minute.’”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XtuHLK&via=Digg&text=You Must Wear Boxer Briefs To Work On Abercrombie CEO's Luxury Jet

div.div: RELAX, YOU'RE TRAPPED IN A CLOSET
There's enough room in the tank that when you float in the middle, you're not touching any wall. If you do lazily pong into one side, the slightest nudge of a finger will set you straight.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VaoXnb&via=Digg&text=Inside A Sensory Deprivation Tank

div.div: BIG RED TECH

div.a: Cornell Releases First Images of New York’s Future Tech Campus

div.div: This 2.1-million-square-foot development aims to make New York's modest Silicon Alley a competitor with its West Coast big brother.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Wn8bGn&via=Digg&text=Cornell Releases First Images of New York’s Future Tech Campus

div.div: DIRTY MOUTHS

Athletic mouthguards are a crucial football equipment item. They protect teeth, tongues and lips. They act as shock absorbers to prevent concussions. And they are a rich delivery system for a range of bacteria, fungi and yeasts associated with a wide variety of diseases and infections.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RJGxRh&via=Digg&text=The NFL's Dirty Little Secret

div.div: LOOK OUT BELOW

div.a: Why Google Could Be In Serious Trouble

div.div: The company's leaked earnings have sent its stock tumbling — shares have even been halted. Google isn't losing money yet, but it is losing its main moneymaker. A dire outlook for one of the tech greats.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WEYqll&via=Digg&text=Why Google Could Be In Serious Trouble

div.div: WAIT, BUSH DOESN'T REALLY CLEAR BRUSH?

div.a: Political Photo Ops From Reagan To Paul Ryan

div.div: Virtually every image you see of a candidate on the trail is contrived. Those old photos of Clinton jogging? Or Bush clearing brush on his Texas ranch? They're all set up.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V8pTIO&via=Digg&text=Political Photo Ops From Reagan To Paul Ryan
